The 737th Training Group revamped U.S. Air Force basic military training to inspire and develop MACH-21 Airmen. In order to achieve this goal, BMT curriculum changes improve all aspects of training across an 8.5-week program that focuses on readiness, lethality, airmanship, fitness and warrior ethos. (U.S. Air Force video by Staff Sgt. Marianique Santos)

The appearance of U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) visual information does not imply or constitute DoD endorsement.

New technology under patent by the U.S. Navy could shift the odds in the favor of stealth aircraft: leveraging lasers to produce plasma bursts that could trick inbound missiles into thinking they’ve found a jet to chase that would actually be little more than a hologram.

Read more about this cutting edge Navy Tech
https://www.sandboxx.us/blog/cutting-edge-navy-tech-could-fake-fighters-ufos-using-lasers/

Military Times Talking lasers and endless flashbangs

The Cold War had a way of everything needing to be bigger. When the F-106's Mach 2.3 wasn't fast enough, the YF-12 entered the scene.

Read the full story here:

Nuclear is the most powerful weapon in the world and it requires highly trained service members to maintain, modify and repair these weapons. 
Working in Nuclear weapons is highly technical field with study required on safety measures, workings of all components and related machinery. The hours are long but the career progression is excellent for those with a love for the job. 

Are you or a loved one about to become the future of the Air Force?
Stay connected at every step of the Air Force journey as well as getting training advice every week with the Sandboxx app: https://link.sandboxx.us/youtube

Every year thousands of trainees attend Air Force Basic Military Training in the hopes of graduating and joining the United Staes Air Force. Here's a glimpse of what's in store for trainees when they arrive, and what their new life will look like. 

Are you considering joining the Air Force? Learn more about what your 8.5 weeks of training will look like.
https://bit.ly/2FFh38U


Video by Staff Sgt. Josh Blackburn, Airman 1st Class Alysia Blake, Senior Airman James Crow, Senior Airman Michael Pfeiffer, Tech. Sgt. Michael Schocker and Airman Harrison Winchell
3rd Audiovisual Squadron

*The appearance of U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) visual information does not imply or constitute DoD endorsement.

Special Operation Combat Control is the ultimate Jack of all trades. Over a 2 year training, you will become a FAA certified air traffic controller as well as scuba and parachute jumping certified.
A Combat Controller's mission is to deploy without detection into hostile or remote areas and establish a base or conduct various control and communications. 
They deploy everything from explosive to weapons to vehicles. Their motto is "First There" and it is a fast-paced and forever learning path within the Air Force.

Assessment & Selection: How the Air Force chooses its commandos
https://bit.ly/3jpH6Qr

Here’s what training is like for the Air Force’s most elite operators:
https://bit.ly/3hwyYMs

Sandboxx builds technology and content for our military and veteran communities. We enable members of the armed forces and their families to stay better connected throughout their military journey.

Week 5 of Air Force Basic Training is infamously known as BEAST week which stands for Basic Expeditionary Airman Skills Training. It is a simulated combat which marks the end of the Basic Military Training aspect of Basic Training. 

Trainees are sent to Medina Annex where they live for the week as they compete with their flights in scenario training, using what they have learnt thus far. 

Pugil sticks and a CLAW mission all occur in this week as future airmen are put to the test on what they've learnt individually and how they operate as a team. Get training advice from former Drill Instructors and recruits delivered to your Sandboxx app every week.

The U.S. Air Force just started taking deliveries on Boeing's new F-15EX, but why invest in new "old" fighters in this era of stealth jets like the F-35 and F-22? Here's everything you need to know.

Each recruit must endure a 13-week program aimed at challenging their mental and physical toughness, as well as problem solving and interpersonal skills. These skills are not only necessary to be successful as a United States Marine, but they’re also essential to accomplishing the missions America entrusts to the Corps.

Learn more about the 13 weeks of Marine Corps boot camp:
https://bit.ly/3oxUEMc

See what you need to do to prepare for boot camp:
https://bit.ly/36PMfh5
